name: operation, computer, desktop, with cathode ray tube display, home use | operation, computer, desktop, home use | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/7532/documentation

The computer desktop home use is calculated according to the share between active (3.14 hrs/day), standby (2.62 hrs/day) and off (18.24 hrs/day) modes taken from survey information. This dataset describes the application of a CRT monitor.

Describes the use of a desktop computer with a CRT monitor. Calculated per 1 hour of computer use at home.
category: J:Information and communication/62:Computer programming, consultancy and related activities/620:Computer programming, consultancy and related activities

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: The data is based on information in Japan. For the computer electricity use data information from various international manufacturers and computer types has been processed.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: No technology involved, except for the production of the desktop computer, which is described in another dataset.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: Producers, literature, survey and own assumptions

flow.name: operation, computer, desktop, home use
flow.category: J:Information and communication/62:Computer programming, consultancy and related activities/620:Computer programming, consultancy and related activities

exchanges.description: Literature value (Williams, 2005) state that computer, while used at home, is used 3.14 hours a day in the active mode, 18.24 hours in the off mode and approximatelly 2.74 hours a day in standby mode. In order to have a sum of 24 hours a day the standby use is adjusted to (24-18.24-3.14=) 2.62 hours a day.
